{Edited following Alexandru's gracious removal of reference to plagiarized font.}

I'm sorry to say that this raises a large red flag - I have to suspect a case of outline theft (possibly involving Rotis).

In fact, please do not recommend or use any fonts by XXXXX since it's become pretty clear that he doesn't respect fellow designers, based on his comments on a recent Typophile thread.

Alexandru, if you could please remove your recommendation I believe that would be good for typeface design in general and Typophile in particular.

hhp
Thanks hrant and Alexandru! I'm still looking for the arabic font's name. Anyone that's familiar with arabic typeface? Thanks again
While the font referenced above appears to fit the "Abdulhamid" text it does not contain Arabic characters -- Russian yes. There is likely a second font associated with your sample.

Dick, Alexandru kindly removed the reference to the offending font.

As for the Arabic font, it sort of reminds me of the Latin typeface FF Profile.

hhp
From what I can see the FF Profile has squared strokes, whereas the OP has angled pointed tails. The problem is the other font which is a fixed width design with "flaired" or "wedge" ends.
@WhatFontIs: hrant does not speak on behalf of Typophile. You are under no obligation to edit your posts based on his suspicions.

Indeed that's true. But nobody should ignore his conscience, especially when the chances of plagiarism are so high.

hhp

Hello  
Thank you Chris.  
The font I recommended is also included in google web fonts.  
I'm not very good with this copyright problems.  
Alex

Google makes an extra effort to avoid tainted goods, so it's probably OK.

hhp
So the result of this banter is that Harif still has no font id - good bad or indifferent.
